title: Syracuse theatre dedications
support: Carved across the rear wall of the terrace separating the upper and lower sections of the theatre cavea, text interrupted by  the breaks between the cunei.

handNote.lettering: Monumental letters without serifs, but with a widening towards the end of terminal strokes. Straight bar alpha; beta with equal loops, closed; epsilon with shorter middle bar; Mu with verical first and last, shorter mid-strokes; omicron consistently smaller and mid-line; rho with closed loop; sigma with slightly open top and bottom strokes, mid-strokes only part width; phi with a small elliptical eye.

date._: In the period subsequent to the establishment of the co-regency of Hieron II and Gelon (i.e. after 241/240 BCE)

provenanceFound._: In situ in the cunei of the diazoma of the theatre of Hieron II, Siracusa

repository._: Area archeologica della Neapolis, Orecchio di Dionisio e Teatro Greco

museum.name: Area archeologica della Neapolis, Orecchio di Dionisio e Teatro Greco
museum.description: Archaeological park, containing the Greek theatre, altar of Hieron, Roman amphitheatre, and ancient stone quarries.
